snippet: The test was ordered by Taiwan’s aviation authority after a deadly crash last week. It was the second fatal accident of a TransAsia plane in less than seven months.
abstract: Ten out of 49 TransAsia Airways pilots fail emergency proficiency tests that were ordered by Civil Aeronautics Administration following plane crash in Taipei, Taiwan; disclosure further damages safety record of airline that has had two deadly accidents in span of seven months.
lead_paragraph: The test was ordered by Taiwan’s aviation authority after a deadly crash last week. It was the second fatal accident of a TransAsia plane in less than seven months.

headline.main: Many Pilots Fail Safety Test at TransAsia
headline.print_headline: Many Pilots Fail Safety Test at TransAsia
